explanation: Agent A is correct. With _DEBUG defined and mhd_assert defined as ((void)0), the if (1) block in MHD_init expands to a block that only declares a local struct timeval tv; the assertion argument (sizeof(...)) is removed by the macro so no compile- or run-time check remains. The declaration has no observable side-effect at runtime (no initialization, no I/O, no function calls). Removing that if (1) block therefore does not change program behaviour, so the code meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (Note: the rule’s timing caveat would only invalidate this conclusion if the presence of the declaration somehow affects observable timing or behaviour in the specific target — no such effect is shown in the scenario.)
